paper_metadata.title: MAIN TEXT
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted genetic variant information for the TTR gene, including penetrance data.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: At 48 months of follow-up, FAP stage and PND class were available in 31 patients.
At 48 months of follow-up, FAP stage and PND class were available in 31 patients.

functional_data.summary: The TTR gene mutations lead to misfolding of the protein, causing amyloid deposits.

variants.segregation_data: Segregates with disease in families as it is an autosomal dominant disorder.
variants.additional_notes: The most common TTR variant mentioned is V30M, which is linked to early and late onset of disease.
key_quotes: About 50% of patients with ATTRv amyloidosis carry this mutation, which has been linked to both an early (30–55 years of age) and a late onset of disease.

tables_processed.table_caption: Baseline characteristics of the study population and disease status

extraction_metadata.notes: All relevant data regarding the TTR gene variants and penetrance were extracted.
